intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis lanigera, commonly known as the wooly pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and often white or pale green, with intricate, delicate petals. It is valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
